name: Auchrannie Country House Hotel

reviews.text: My friend and I recently went on a 2 day holiday in Arran and stayed at the Auchrannie House Hotel. The room was really lovely. The beds were extremely comfortable, the good size TV was good to watch when we were tired after a day exploring Arran. The complimentary water was really welcome as was the use of a fridge to keep our wine cold. Both the House hotel and the spa hotel had swimming pools and pamper facilities. I had a very relaxing massage and it was reasonably priced and very good. The dining facilities were excellent. We had breakfast in the Eighteen69 restaurant looking out on beautiful gardens. In the evenings we ate at the Brambles restaurant and the staff were very attentive. I loved the fact that the hotel resort used Arran Aromatic products in the bathroom and selections of Arran cheeses in the restuarant. I would definately recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: 2 night stay with a friend

reviews.text: Spent two nights at the Auchrannie Spa resort recently and had a thoroughly great time. My daughter and I went on a "couples" package and availed ourselves of a 3 hour pamper session plus used the pool, sauna and steam room. We had a bottle of bubbly in our room on arrival which we did not drink and forgot to bring home!
reviews.title: 2 nights = not long enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate lunch in Cruize both days where the menu is varied and the burgers are homemade and juicy. The soup was also very good. For dinner we opted for Cruize the first night and Brambles the second night. Cruize is a more family oriented dining experience but the food is very good. Brambles has a nice ambience and the surroundings are also very tasteful. Brambles is mainly seafood and the cullen skink is to die for - it had a poached egg on top! Breakfast both days was served in Cruize and what a selection, we even had smoked and hot smoked salmon as part of the choice! Everything was well cooked and we stuffed our faces both days lol.
reviews.title: Puppies first holiday

reviews.text: Accomodation was spacious, clean and comfortable and with free wi-fi this hotel ticks the boxes.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was good and staff are generally friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Lives up to its reputation

reviews.text: Having only discovered Auchrannie, and the Isle of Arran because my brother's wedding was being held there, we were delighted by the whole experience.
reviews.title: Something for everyone!

reviews.text: There were approx 50 friends and relatives staying for the wedding - some in the old hotel, some in the new, and some in the lodges.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, beautiful surroundings, great access for the disabled and you can take your dog!

reviews.text: We stayed in the old hotel, and aside from the long walk up stairs and along corridors to get to our room (and the hard bed), were very happy with our accommodation. In fact, I only mention the walk for those people who have mobility issues, as they would need to mention this when booking as there is no lift (I assume the spa hotel is more 'accessible')
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel for Wedding celebrations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having not 1 pool/spa but 2, was brilliant - the pool in the old hotel is smaller and quieter, and has less children using it. Unfortunately, due to the wedding we didn't get much use out of either though. Nor did we get to use the sports hall, or snooker room. There is a good sized gym there and a room for exercise classes.
reviews.title: The Welcome on Arran Island
Overpowering Weddings
reviews.text: Kids of all ages are well catered for - there's a teen room with arcade games etc. and for smaller children there is the play barn. We don't have kids so didn't check these out.

reviews.title: Another fantastic stay with Auchrannie
reviews.text: Another fantastic stay at the Auchrannie. Having stayed at the Spa Hotel on two previous occasions we took advantage of the Auchrannie Buddy offer and tried the Country House. We were not disappointed. Everything about this hotel is friendly quality service. Reception is small but very efficient with friendly polite staff. Our room was perfect, comfortable bed, free in room wifi and a brilliant shower. There was a safe in the wardrobe and a courtesy umbrella (handy for any time of year in Scotland). The food in Brambles was second to none, highly recommend you try it out. Breakfast was serviced in the 1869 restaurant. Self service at the cold buffet and table service for a choice of hot breakfasts. Dog friendly hotel with separate entrance and towels for drying. Join the Buddies club for email offers. Take a trip to Isle of Arran Distillery at Lochranza, worth a visit on a wet day.

reviews.title: Auchrannie is awesome
reviews.text: Auchrannie was a destination for us after 3 months without a break. What an amazing decision. The place has simply rocked our holiday from the start to the finish. The staff are awesome, they are incredibly helpful and always genuinely happy to see you. The food in the Brambles restuarant is simply to die for. I defy anyone to say their famous chunky fishcake and famous chunky fish pie are not the best in the world and this is coming from a non fish lover!!!!!! We were only here for a week it turned out this was just not long enough and we cannot wait to come back. 10/10.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic time at Auchrannie - wish we could have stayed longer! Service was very good, from check-in to departure, and the room was well equipped and spotlessly clean We had dinner in Brambles, where the food was tasty and cooked well. The waiting staff were friendly and efficient. There was a slight mix up with our order, which was rectified within 5 minutes of our telling the apologetic waiter - so it didn't detract from our experience at all. Breakfast was one of the best we've experienced - great choice in the buffet and excellent cooked to order choices. I also had a relaxing massage in the spa - would highly recommend. Certainly intend to return soon.
reviews.title: Lovely rooms, great service, excellent breakfast.

reviews.text: Traditional hotel, modern spa or a luxury lodge. We have been to Auchrannie in beautiful Arran many times. We have stayed with groups of friends in the self-catering lodges and with family in the spa resort.
reviews.title: Something for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The heart of Auchrannie is a traditional hotel which has very comfortable public areas with a bar and coal fire. There are two restaurants and swimming pool complex The spa is a modern development with large functional and well furnished bedrooms plus a great gym and leisure complex. There is a large swimming pool, kids pool, steam room and sauna. There are steamer chairs for lounging around the pool.
reviews.title: Relaxing Break in Beautiful Surroundings
Rip-off
reviews.text: I went on line to book a return holiday at Auchrannie, the price quoted for a week was £836, as it was a special occasion I contacted the hotel for a price for a suite they offered one at £1410 for the week, a bit too expensive so I I said i would take the room , he then quoted me £1430 for the room! Amazed I assured him the online price was £836 which was still showing on my screen, he said press the refresh button and sure enough the price changed to £1365, in the space of 10 minutes the price had risen by £500. he explained that the hotel uses the same computer system as airlines the more "hits" on a specific date the more the price increased, so by me and him checking dates and rooms the price increased. £500+ in a few minutes. Fortunately, unlike air travel, Arran has numerous places to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outstanding service, wonderful food - exceptional choice at breakfast. Friendly efficient staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful - best hotel we have every stayed in.

reviews.text: First class facilities. Even the weater couldn't spoil our stay. Have stayed in the Resort side some 3 occasions previously as a family. Stayed in the House Hotel this time being just the two of us and found it more relaxing without being on the fuddy duddy side. Comfortable clean rooms. Faultless. Great job.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really enjoyed my weekend thought the service was excellent . My only flaw was the hotel is on 2 sites & I would have preferred it altogether but it still deserves 5 stars for the service we received. All the staff were very welcoming & we were a large party & were catered for very well.
reviews.title: Auchrannie Ideal for an Anniversary but We Will Bring the Family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to get away for 1 night to celebrate our anniversary. We had always intended to go to Auchrannie on Arran but had somehow never previously got round to it. It was definitely worthwhile from the initial reception to the check out and at all times in between. The room was comfortable, well furnished and had a good view our over the gardens. We enjoyed a swim in the pool before dinner and dinner itself in the 1869 restaurant was excellent - good service, food and wine. We relaxed on a comfy sofa in the bar after dinner and enjoyed a good nights sleep. The breakfast was excellent - especially the choice of fruits and juices. Added to this Arran is a great island - plenty to see and do. We spend most of our time walking but we also enjoyed Brodick Castle and putting on Brodick seafront. Next time we will probably bring the family.
reviews.title: outstanding! and yet not the right choice for us

description: Auchrannie Spa Resort consists of three separate accommodations - Auchrannie Spa Resort, Auchrannie Country Club and Auchrannie Country House Hotel.
